main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.msg

Class SystemLogMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.msg.LogMessage
      • main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.msg.SystemLogMessage

  • public class SystemLogMessage
extends LogMessage
    Represents a system log message for the simulator. Is used by ERSSpecificModule to create system log messages for those events that have to be logged according to BSI TR-03151.
    The parameters managed by this class are the operation type, the system operation data and additional internal data. The value of each of these parameters is determined by the same technical guideline.
    Author:
    dpottkaemper

    • Constructor Detail

      • SystemLogMessage

        public SystemLogMessage()
        The default constructor for a SystemLogMessage. Sets only the two parameters it can set independently, which are the version and the certifiedDataType. Everything else has to be set using the setter methods. It is recommended that the other constructors are used.

      • SystemLogMessage

        public SystemLogMessage(java.lang.String operationType,
                        byte[] serialNumber)
        Constructor for a SystemLogMessage when the operationType and the serial number are known. In that case, these parameters are assigned with the values that were passed to this constructor and in addition, the version and certifiedDataType are set. The algorithm value has to be set manually.
        Parameters:
        operationType - the name of the operation that this SystemLogMessage logs. For example "UpdateTime".
        serialNumber - serialNumber the serial number of the TSE.

      • SystemLogMessage

        public SystemLogMessage(java.lang.String operationType,
                        byte[] systemOperationData,
                        byte[] serialNumber)
        Constructor for a SystemLogMessage when the operationType, the systemOperationData and the serialNumber are known. In that case, these parameters are assigned with the values that were passed to this constructor and in addition, the version and certifiedDataType are set. The algorithm value has to be set manually.
        Parameters:
        operationType - the name of the operation that this SystemLogMessage logs. For example "UpdateTime".
        systemOperationData - the data that has to be logged with this SystemLogMessage, encoded as a TLV byte array as specified by BSI TR-03151.
        serialNumber - the serial number of the TSE.

      • SystemLogMessage

        public SystemLogMessage(TLVObject[] input)
                 throws ValueNullException,
                        ValueTooBigException,
                        java.lang.NullPointerException
        Constructs a SystemLogMessage from a TLVObject[]. This is used to retrieve information like the signatureCounter from the signed LogMessage without having to parse the whole TLV byte array each time. Instead, the byte array is decoded into a TLVObject[] via TLVObject.decodeASN1ByteArrayToTLVObjectArray(byte[]).
        The calling method has to make sure that the TLVObject[] is without the Sequence-wrapper that the SecurityModule attaches. The calling method has to also ensure, that the TLVobject[] does indeed represent a SystemLogMessage and that the content of that SystemLogMessage is in the correct order. Since SystemLogMessages differ very much in the amount of systemOperationData, this method only checks if the input is null. It does not check for minimum or maximum length like the same constructor in the TransactionLogMessage.
        Parameters:
        input - a SystemLogMessage in its representation as a TLVObject[] without the SEQUENCE-wrapper.
        Throws:
        ValueTooBigException - gets thrown by the conversion methods TLVUtility.asn1Value_ByteArrayToInteger(byte[]) and TLVUtility.asn1Value_ByteArrayToLong(byte[]).
        ValueNullException - gets thrown by the conversion methods TLVUtility.asn1Value_ByteArrayToInteger(byte[]) and TLVUtility.asn1Value_ByteArrayToLong(byte[]).
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the input array is empty
        See Also:
        TransactionLogMessage.TransactionLogMessage(TLVObject[])

    • Method Detail

      • setOperationType

        public void setOperationType(java.lang.String operationType)
        Setter for the operation type.
        Parameters:
        operationType - the type of operation, e.g. "updateTime".

      • setSystemOperationData

        public void setSystemOperationData(byte[] sysOpdata)
        Setter for the system operation data. This data has to be encoded as an ASN.1 DER structure. It has to be structured the way the technical guideline wants it to be structured.
        Parameters:
        sysOpdata - a byte array of system operation data. Depends on the operation that it logs.

      • setAdditionalInternalData

        public void setAdditionalInternalData(byte[] additionalIntData)
        Setter for additional internal data. Is optional.
        Parameters:
        additionalIntData - internal data structured as a BER encoded TLV object.

        public byte[] getAdditionalInternalData()
        Getter for the additional internal data.
        Returns:
        the additional internal data in its TLV form, or null, if none is present.

      • toMinorTLVByteArray

        public byte[] toMinorTLVByteArray()
                           throws ValueNullException,
                                  ValueTooBigException
        Converts the SystemLogMessage into its ASN.1 DER encoded form using TLVObject.toTLVByteArray(). It assumes that every value that should be present in a SystemLogMessage conforming to BSI TR-03151 is present. This is because it is only used to create SystemLogMessages in the context of this simulator and the calling classes provide all the necessary values.
        The missing values, signature counter, log time and signature value, can only be provided by the CryptoCore after the upper part of the log message has been converted into this TLV byte array. Hence the name MinorTLVByteArray, since it is not yet complete. The assembly of the whole log message in its TLV byte array form is performed by ERSSpecificModule.
        Returns:
        the upper part of the SystemLogMessage in its ASN.1 DER encoded form.
        Throws:
        ValueNullException - if an (instance) parameter that should be present is not and therefore this Exception is thrown when trying to convert that particular value to a TLV byte array via TLVObject.toTLVByteArray().
        ValueTooBigException - if the value of an (instance) parameter is too long to have its length encoded according to the ASN1 DER rules, TLVObject.toTLVByteArray() throws this exception.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of a system log message object. It only returns the content of each parameter. If the log message should be represented in its TLV form, it is required that it is turned into a TLV byte array and that TLVObject.tlvObjectArrayToString(TLVObject[]) is used.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
